title: How to check on my DELL computer model number - Quora

response.answer_text: You can find the model number for your dell pc on this 3 places of you laptops. Bottom of LaptopCheck the bottom of your laptop (base). The model number (Model No) is not what you are looking for. You need to find the model labeled: Latitude, Inspiron, Precision, Studio, Vostro, or XPS. Dell "Power On" ScreenMost models of Dell laptops display the make and model on your Dell "power on" boot screen. This is the easiest way to find your laptop model. Center Control CoverSome models of Dell Laptops display the make and model on your center control cover (power button cover) located just above your keyboard. Not all will do this, some will just display the make and not the entire model.

It'll either be printed on the front of the system or on the asset tag sticker on the case somewhere. Dell desktops are usually Optiplex’s. Failing that and if there's no service tag sticker, have a look in the BIOS (press F2 on boot) as the service tag and model info will be in there under general info. If you can't get into BIOS, boot into Windows and run up a command prompt and type the following (with spaces): wmic bios get serialnumber Once you have the service tag, go to dells website/support section and enter it there, and it will return all information on the system.
